\quote{"Evolutionary botanist, who combines phylogenetic data with ecological information to understand how biodiversity is generated and maintained across space and time."}

\section{Work and Research Experience}
%\subsection{current employment}
\cventry{since 10/2017}{Postdoctoral Fellow}{Life and Environmental Science, University of California}{Merced}{}{Developing a tool to automatically and rapidly update phylogenies, linking species and geographic information that can be easily used for biogeographic analyses}

%\subsection{past experience and employment}

\cventry{02/2013 -- 10/2015}{Research assistant}{Institute of 'Spezielle Botanik und Botanischer Garten', Johannes Gutenberg-Universität}{Mainz/Germany}{}{Doctoral student in the DFG-project of Dr. B. \section{Advanced Trainings}
\cventry{12/2017}{Computable evolutionary phenotype knowledge: a hands-on workshop}{Phenoscape Knowledgebase}{Durham, North Carolina, USA}{4 days}{Connecting the database with IdigBio and developing a shiny app to display the distribution of species traits on a map}
\cventry{10/2015}{Introduction to Bioinformatics for Biosystematics}{ForBio}{Oslo, Norway}{7 days}{Usage of Python, SQL and R for systematic research questions}
\cventry{10/2014}{Species Tree Phylogenetics}{ForBio}{Kristineberg, Sweden}{5 days}{Species coalescent theories and assumptions; final report about paralogy assessment}
\cventry{05/2014}{Computational Molecular Evolution}{EMBO}{Heraklion, Greece}{10 days}{Theories of dataset assembly, hypothesis testing in phylogenies and coalescent model}
